britannica ref in the legacy section. It violates NPOV to include fanatical anti-communists like Pipes and Courtois as sources, and not Britannica.

Undid revision 443907514 by [[Special:Contributions/46.176.187.173|46.176.187.173]] ([[User talk:46.176.187.173|talk]]) [[WP:PEACOCK]]. wikipediaâ britannica. phrases like "must be" are purely opinionated.
and Lothar is more neutral than britannica? The statement isn't there to glorify Lenin (it says "for good or ill") it's there to show his huge importance, which no serious scholar denies
Undid revision 443884462 by [[Special:Contributions/46.176.187.173|46.176.187.173]] ([[User talk:46.176.187.173|talk]]) opinionated and essay-like statement, just more [[WP:Britannica mistakes]]
the britannica ref isn't POV-pushing. It just expresses the historical reality. And the ref is taken verbatim from the Encyclopedia
Undid revision 443773741 by [[Special:Contributions/46.176.109.54|46.176.109.54]] ([[User talk:46.176.109.54|talk]]) Nobody is denying Lenin's importance. This is a violation of [[WP:NPOV]].
restored britannica ref with "according to britannica" note. Now there is absolutely no excuse for removing it. Whether you like Lenin or not, you can't deny his importance

I added "citation needed" to the claim that the Blank family in Lenin's mother's ancestry was Jewish. This is a contested issue. There is a known Jewish family with this name, but no proof that they were Lenin's ancestors.
